title: Began Typescript class just to shake things up
description: Made first tiny Typescript app. Learning about type annotations vs type inference.  Learned about annotating different values from primitives to objects,classes,arrays and functions. Learned about typed arrays and having multiple values. Learned about annotating tuples and how we'll probably never use them ha ha.

title: Made it to client side on the Grider project
description: Finally made it to the client side and added the React server. Added the concurrently module for simultaneous server starting. Refactored the then() promises to async and await.
tools: express, heroku, oauth, passportjs, cookies, mongoose, google

title: MERN project and started doing Exercism problems
description: I started doing the Javascript track at on exercism.io.  I always sort of enjoy doing algorithm practice until i don't... ha ha. Working on the Node with React class finally made it so the user can logout. I think authenication is finally over. Made a production setup and a dev set up.
tools: express, heroku, oauth, passportjs, cookies, mongoose, google

title: Still Working Through Authentication
description: Added Oauth and cookies to authorize the User. Wrote a route to test the entire Oauth flow.
tools: express, heroku, oauth, passportjs, cookies, mongoose, google

title: Began the Node with React: Fullstack Web Development Course
description: I'm really trying to familiarize myself fully with full-stack web development so I'm taking another Stephen Grider course. I started the express app and deployed to heroku. Spent a great deal of time lecturing about Passport and Oauth eventually finally go the user id (as provided by google) into the database.
tools: express, heroku, oauth, passportjs, cookies, mongoose, google

title: MongoDB new Stephen Grider Project
description: Added the updateMany query to artists being retired or not retired.  Finished the UpStarMusic project. Finished the project! Started the next and final project of the course.  Making a backend for a Uber rippoff using Express, Mongoose, MongoDB and testing with Mocha and Supertest. Added controllers and routers. Downloaded the Postman App (previously used Insomnia) and checked the PUT request. Added a second database just for testing. Added error handling middleware for the create route. Added update route and tested it.  Added a PointSchema subfdocument for geolocation. Added query for drivers around a certain point geographically.  The final function of the course (geoNear) was deprecated so the final test didn't work... womp womp.  I could figure it out later but  I FINISHED THE COURSE!
tools: mongodb, mongoose, mocha, javascript, node, sort, crud, limit, skip, geojson, middleware, subdocument, postman

title: MongoDB new Stephen Grider Project
description: Started a new project within the Complete Developers Guide to MongoDB called 'UpStarMusic'.  We started out by making Artist and Album Schemas/models.  Then we moved on to doing the more simple CRUD queries. Added minimum/maximum sort and limit queries for the collection.
tools: mongodb, mongoose, mocha, javascript, node, sort, crud, limit, skip

title: Mongo DB populating
description: Populated the User blogPosts.  Added middleware and a middleware test to clean up all user blog posts when the user is deleted. Learned about and used Promise.all() which seems pretty handy in my opinion.  We learned about Pagination and implemented sort(), skip(), and limit().  Finished that first project üèÅ
tools: mongodb, mongoose, mocha, javascript, node, subdocument, virtual type associations

title: Mongo DB subdocuments and associations
description: Added subdocument PostSchema to the User Model.  Tested adding and removing subdocuments to and fron existing records.  Added a virtual type to take the place of the incrementally defined postCount. Created associations using Refs.
tools: mongodb, mongoose, mocha, javascript, node, subdocument, virtual type associations

title: Mongo DB queries and operators
description: Went through the many different queries you can use to achieve full CRUD in MongoDB and Mongoose. Used the increment update operator.  Also inplemented basic validation requiring a name and the name length to be more than 2 characters.
tools: mongodb, mongoose, mocha, javascript, node, validation, operators, queries

title: Slowly moving through Mongo DB
description: Built a lot of mocha tests today while following the class. Getting back to the basics of MongoDB and Mongoose. Broke out the old Robo3T app, made a Schema, did find and findOne queries.  It's been very good review so far

title: The Complete Developers Guide to MongoDB
description: Started the Stephen Grider 13 hour MongoDB course on Udemy.  I think I could use some polishing on the back end.

title: Fixed bigfoot app and put it on portfolio.
description: The bigfoot app wasn't getting all the information from the bigfoot sightings API so I had to make another get request and then combine the arrays.  It was easier than I thought it would be.  I then added that project to this portfolio page.

title: Sorta finished the Bigfoot App
description: I worked on the bigfoot app today and added some ridiculous CSS and soundeffects for my own enjoyment.  It's close to done but I kind of wish i could have gotten the bigfoot pins to only appear on getting the users current position and I'd also like to have a search bar.  The api call isn't getting all the results so I have to figure out how to make subsequent fetches tomorrow. Wasn't as fun as I thought it would be :/
tools: react, api, css, javascript, animation, transitions, mapbox

title: Worked on the Bigfoot App
description: Worked all day long on the Bigfoot App. It was pretty frusterating because I couldn't get the state to keep up with the rendering from the API call.  I ended up just using a variable which i think is a no no but it sort of worked. Mapbox is pretty cool.  I would like it if bigfoot sighting pins would only load if they are within 10 miles of the user but that seems like a big battle.

title: Started working on the Bigfoot App
description: MEMORIAL DAY - I'm trying to get a users current position on a map that's proving to be more difficult then I thought iT would be because the async nature of getting a location

title: Added Filter Buttons to Portfolio
description: I added icon buttons to the top of the page that when clicked will filter the projects out that have that used that tool during developement.

title: Built Progress Log
description: This is my very first entry into the 'Progress Log' and the progress that I'm loggin is the 'Progress Log' itself. I fetched a local JSON with the information on it and looped over it to make this list (only 1 entry right now).  Then made it searchable by Title, Description or Tools. Had to change the function component into a class component which wasn't all that bad. I'll try and log things i've learned, tasks I've accomplished or failed here... Probably should make this log responsive ha ha. üöÄ
tools: react, javascript, json, sticky, css, bootstrap, tables
